messages.content: Nice to meet you, Amritendu! How can I help you with general medical information today?

To prevent viral fever, it is important to practice good hygiene habits such as regularly washing hands with soap and water or using alcohol-based hand rub. Covering coughs and sneezes with a bent elbow or tissue, disposing of used tissues correctly, and avoiding close contact with sick individuals can also help prevent the spread of viruses that cause fever. Additionally, getting vaccinated against viruses like influenza and hepatitis can provide protection against specific viral infections. Disclaimer: This information is for general knowledge and informational purposes only, and does not constitute medical advice. Please consult a qualified healthcare professional for any medical concerns.

Dengue is a viral infection transmitted to humans through the bite of infected mosquitoes, primarily through Aedes aegypti mosquitoes and, to a lesser extent, Aedes albopictus. It is the most rapidly spreading mosquito-borne viral disease in the world. More than 3.9 billion people in over 129 countries are at risk of contracting dengue, with an estimated 96 million symptomatic cases and an estimat...

V) begins with mild fever, reduced appetite, nausea and vomiting lasting for a few days. Some persons may also have abdominal pain, itching (without skin lesions), skin rash or joint pain. They may also exhibit jaundice, with dark urine and pale stools, and a slightly enlarged, tender liver (hepatomegaly), or occasionally acute liver failure. messages.content: Vitamin B12, also known as cobalamin, is a large B complex vitamin that plays a crucial role in human metabolic processes. It is essential for the functioning of certain enzymes in mammalian cells. Vitamin B12 is primarily found in animal products such as milk, meat, eggs, and poultry. It is absorbed in a complex process in the stomach and duodenum. Vegans are at risk of vitamin B12 deficiency as they do not consume animal products. Disclaimer: This information is for general knowledge and informational purposes only, and does not constitute medical advice. Please consult a qualified healthcare professional for any medical concerns.

14.1 Role of vitamin B 12 in human metabolic processes
Although the nutritional literature still uses the term vitamin B 12, a more
speciﬁc name for vitamin B 12 is cobalamin. Vitamin B12 is the largest of the B
complex vitamins, with a relative molecular mass of over 1000. It consists of
a corrin ring made up of four pyrroles with cobalt at the centre of the ring
(1, 2).

messages.content: Foods high in vitamin B12 include animal products such as milk, meat, eggs, poultry, and cheese. It is important to note that vitamin B12 is primarily derived from animal tissues or products. Some vegetable fermentation preparations have been reported as possible sources of vitamin B12 as well. Disclaimer: This information is for general knowledge and informational purposes only, and does not constitute medical advice. Please consult a qualified healthcare professional for any medical concerns.

messages.content: Symptoms of dehydration can include increased thirst, dry mouth, tiredness, decreased urine output, dark yellow urine, headache, dizziness, and dry skin. If you suspect dehydration, it is important to drink fluids and seek medical attention if symptoms worsen. Disclaimer: This information is for general knowledge and informational purposes only, and does not constitute medical advice. Please consult a qualified healthcare professional for any medical concerns.

messages.content:
For a minor burn, you can follow these basic first aid steps: 1) Cool the burn by holding it under cool running water for at least 10 minutes.
2) Remove any clothing or jewelry near the burn area, unless it is stuck to the skin.
3) Cover the burn with a sterile, non-adhesive dressing or a clean cloth.
4) Do not apply ice, butter, or ointments to the burn.
5) Monitor the burn for signs of infection, such as increased pain, redness, or swelling. If the burn is severe, covers a large area, or is on the face, hands, feet, or genitals, seek medical attention immediately. Disclaimer: This information is for general knowledge and informational purposes only, and does not constitute medical advice. Please consult a qualified healthcare professional for any medical concerns.

messages.content: Is exercise good for managing stress

Exercise is indeed good for managing stress. Physical activity can influence both psychological and physical health, and moderate exercise is recommended as a way to distract from disturbing emotions, build self-esteem, and increase feelings of being in control. However, it is always important to consult with a doctor before starting an exercise program, especially if you have any underlying health conditions. Disclaimer: This information is for general knowledge and informational purposes only, and does not constitute medical advice. Please consult a qualified healthcare professional for any medical concerns.

Exercise and Physical Activity
Adults over the age of 20 years should undertake a minimum of 30-45 minutes of
physical activity of moderate intensity (such as brisk walking 5-6 km/hr) 5-6 days of the week.
Greater health benefits can be obtained by engaging in physical activity of longer duration or
more vigorous intensity such as jogging, running, cycling and swimming.

messages.content: Should I take antibiotics for a sore throat

I cannot provide personalized treatment recommendations. However, for a sore throat, it is important to rest, stay hydrated, and consider using over-the-counter pain relievers like acetaminophen or ibuprofen. If your symptoms persist or worsen, it is advisable to seek care from a qualified healthcare professional. Disclaimer: This information is for general knowledge and informational purposes only, and does not constitute medical advice. Please consult a qualified healthcare professional for any medical concerns.

Antimicrobial resistance Key facts Antimicrobial resistance (AMR) is one of the top global public health and development threats. It is estimated that bacterial AMR was directly responsible for 1.27 million global deaths in 2019 and contributed to 4.95 million deaths (1) . The misuse and overuse of antimicrobials in humans, animals and plants are the main drivers in the development of drug-resista...

Over the last 50 years, human activities have released sufficient quantities of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases to affect the global climate. The resulting changes in the global climate bring a range of risks to health, from deaths in extreme high temperatures to changing patterns of infectious diseases.
